sub_concepts.name: Kinetic Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The energy of motion, defined as the work done by a force to move an object from its initial position to its final position.

sub_concepts.name: Potential Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The energy of position or configuration, defined as the work done by a force to move an object from its reference position to its actual position.

sub_concepts.name: Mechanical Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The sum of kinetic energy and potential energy of an object or system.

sub_concepts.name: Thermal Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The energy associated with the temperature of an object or system, which can be transferred between objects through heat transfer processes.

sub_concepts.name: Electrical Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The energy associated with the movement of charged particles, such as electrons in a conductor.

sub_concepts.name: Chemical Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The energy stored in chemical bonds between atoms or molecules, which can be released through chemical reactions.

sub_concepts.name: Nuclear Energy
sub_concepts.definition: The energy stored in the nucleus of an atom, which can be released through nuclear reactions such as fission or fusion.
